io.github.goodees.ese.core.store

Interface Serialization<T>


  • public interface Serialization<T>
    Common interface for serialization and deserialization into String payload. Both event and snapshot stores might utilize this to define entity-specific conversions.

    We expect that during lifetime of the project, the serialization scenarios might change. Whenever the serialized object changes in incompatible manager, serialization should start using different unique payload version for it.

    Payload version will be stored separately by the store, and will be provided to method Serialization{@link #deserialize(int, String, String)}

    Usually an application writes into most recent payload version, however needs to be able to read the past versions of the object.

    • Method Detail

      • payloadVersion

        int payloadVersion(T object)
        Determine version of payload to be used for serialization.
        Parameters:
        object - object to be serialized
        Returns:
        payload version.

      • serialize

        String serialize(T object)
        Serialize the object into a String payload.
        Parameters:
        object - object to serialize
        Returns:
        String serialization of the object

      • deserialize

        T deserialize(int payloadVersion,
              String payload,
              String type)
        Deserialize a payload given its version. As noted above, serialization must support reading all past versions of payloads.
        Parameters:
        payloadVersion - the version of the payload as stored in the store
        payload - payload to deserialize
        type - a type discriminator if supported by underlying storage, null otherwise
        Returns:
        deserialized object or null if makes sense for the usecase. Might be ok for snapshots, event recovery would fail.

      • toSerializable

        T toSerializable(Object o)
        Return object of correct type, if its class is supported.

        Even though entity APIs are quite generic in terms of produced types, they are in fact be constrained to more specific parent classes. To support serialization in generic terms we need such helper method, that will guarantee proper type that can be passed further.

        Parameters:
        o - object to cast
        Returns:
        casted object, or null if instance is of unsupported type.

      • none

        static <T> Serialization<T> none()
